channel.title: About on MCP Toolbox for Databases
channel.description: Recent content in About on MCP Toolbox for Databases

item.title: FAQ
item.description:
How can I deploy or run Toolbox?

MCP Toolbox for Databases is open-source and can be ran or deployed to a multitude of environments. For convenience, we release compiled binaries and docker images (but you can always compile yourself as well!).

For detailed instructions, check our these resources:

  • Quickstart: How to Run Locally
  • Deploy to Cloud Run

Do I need a Google Cloud account/project to get started with Toolbox?

Nope! While some of the sources Toolbox connects to may require GCP credentials, Toolbox doesn’t require them and can connect to a bunch of different resources that don’t.

item.title: Blogs
item.description:
Toolbox Tuesday Blogs

Every Tuesday, we post a blog on our Medium page. These blogs will be covering topics, tutorials, or samples that are related to developing with Toolbox. Follow us and stay tuned!

Previous Blogs

  • Powering your IDEâ€™s build-time agents with MCP Toolbox for Databases
  • Using HTTP endpoints as tools with MCP Toolbox for Databases

item.title: Contact Us
item.description:
Toolbox is an open source project and we welcome contributions and discussion from the developer community.

How to Get in Touch

  • If you want to make a contribution, open an issue first so that we can agree on the general design.

  • If you found a bug or have ideas for improvements, open an issue and we will reply as soon as possible.

  • For any topics, join our discord server, where we can discuss things in real-time for a faster response.
